00039 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS ***********************/
00040 /* For DMA controller */
00041 #define DMA_DATA_SIZE   65
00042 
00043 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00044 uint8_t menu1[] =
00045 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00046 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00047 "SSP demo \n\r"
00048 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00049 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00050 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200bps \n\r"
00051 " This example uses SSP function in MASTER mode \n\r"
00052 " with Loop-back mode (MOSI <-> MISO) \n\r"
00053 " Transfer 64 bytes of data (in DMA mode for both Tx and Rx \n\r"
00054 " channel) \n\r"
00055 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00056 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";

00058 // SSP Configuration structure variable
00059 SSP_CFG_Type SSP_ConfigStruct;
00060 
00061 // Terminal Counter flag for Channel 0
00062 __IO uint32_t Channel0_TC;
00063 
00064 // Error Counter flag for Channel 0
00065 __IO uint32_t Channel0_Err;
00066 
00067 // Terminal Counter flag for Channel 1
00068 __IO uint32_t Channel1_TC;
00069 
00070 // Error Counter flag for Channel 1
00071 __IO uint32_t Channel1_Err;
00072 
00073 // DMA source variable
00074 uint8_t dma_src[DMA_DATA_SIZE];
00075 
00076 // DMA source variable
00077 uint8_t dma_dst[DMA_DATA_SIZE];

00088 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00089 /*********************************************************************/
00094 void DMA_IRQHandler (void)
00095 {
00096         // check GPDMA interrupt on channel 0
00097         if (GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INT, 0)){
00098                 // Check counter terminal status
00099                 if(GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INTTC, 0)){
00100                         // Clear terminate counter Interrupt pending
00101                         GPDMA_ClearIntPending (GPDMA_STATCLR_INTTC, 0);
00102                                 Channel0_TC++;
00103                 }
00104                 // Check error terminal status
00105                 if (GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INTERR, 0)){
00106                         // Clear error counter Interrupt pending
00107                         GPDMA_ClearIntPending (GPDMA_STATCLR_INTERR, 0);
00108                         Channel0_Err++;
00109                 }
00110         }
00111         // check GPDMA interrupt on channel 1
00112         if (GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INT, 1)){
00113                 // Check counter terminal status
00114                 if(GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INTTC, 1)){
00115                         // Clear terminate counter Interrupt pending
00116                         GPDMA_ClearIntPending (GPDMA_STATCLR_INTTC, 1);
00117                                 Channel1_TC++;
00118                 }
00119                 // Check error terminal status
00120                 if (GPDMA_IntGetStatus(GPDMA_STAT_INTERR, 1)){
00121                         // Clear error counter Interrupt pending
00122                         GPDMA_ClearIntPending (GPDMA_STATCLR_INTERR, 1);
00123                         Channel1_Err++;
00124                 }
00125         }
00126 }
00127 
00128 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS------------------------------*/
00129 /*********************************************************************/
00134 void Buffer_Init(void)
00135 {
00136         uint32_t i;
00137         uint8_t *src_addr = (uint8_t *)dma_src;
00138         uint8_t *dest_addr = (uint8_t *)dma_dst;
00139 
00140          for ( i = 0; i < DMA_DATA_SIZE; i++ )
00141         {
00142                 *src_addr++ = i;
00143                 *dest_addr++ = 0;
00144         }
00145 }
00146 
00147 /*********************************************************************/
00152 void Buffer_Verify(void)
00153 {
00154         uint32_t i;
00155         uint8_t *src_addr = (uint8_t *)dma_src;
00156         uint8_t *dest_addr = (uint8_t *)dma_dst;
00157 
00158         for ( i = 0; i < DMA_DATA_SIZE; i++ )
00159         {
00160                 if ( *src_addr++ != *dest_addr++ )
00161                 {
00162                         /* Call Error Loop */
00163                         _DBG_("Verify error");
00164                         Error_Loop();
00165                 }
00166         }
00167 }
00168 
00169 /*********************************************************************/
00174 void Error_Loop(void)
00175 {
00176         /* Loop forever */
00177         while (1);
00178 }
00179 
00180 /*********************************************************************/
00185 void print_menu(void)
00186 {
00187         _DBG(menu1);
00188 }

00190 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00191 /*********************************************************************/
00196 int c_entry(void)
00197 {
00198         GPDMA_Channel_CFG_Type GPDMACfg;
00199         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00200 
00201         /*
00202          * Initialize SSP pin connect
00203          * P0.15 - SCK;
00204          * P0.16 - SSEL
00205          * P0.17 - MISO
00206          * P0.18 - MOSI
00207          */
00208         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00209         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00210         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00211         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00212         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00213         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00214         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00215         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00216         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00217         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00218         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00219         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00220 
00221         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00222          * – 115200bps
00223          * – 8 data bit
00224          * – No parity
00225          * – 1 stop bit
00226          * – No flow control
00227          */
00228         debug_frmwrk_init();
00229 
00230         // print welcome screen
00231         print_menu();
00232 
00233         /* Initializing SSP device section ------------------------------------------------------ */
00234         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00235         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00236         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00237         SSP_Init(LPC_SSP0, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00238 
00239         // Enable SSP peripheral
00240         SSP_Cmd(LPC_SSP0, ENABLE);
00241 
00242 
00243         /* GPDMA Interrupt configuration section ------------------------------------------------- */
00244         /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00245         NVIC_SetPriority(DMA_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00246         /* Enable SSP0 interrupt */
00247         NVIC_EnableIRQ(DMA_IRQn);
00248 
00249 
00250         /* Initializing Buffer section ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00251         Buffer_Init();
00252 
00253     /* Initialize GPDMA controller */
00254         GPDMA_Init();
00255 
00256 
00257         /* Setting GPDMA interrupt */
00258     // Disable interrupt for DMA
00259     NVIC_DisableIRQ (DMA_IRQn);
00260     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00261     NVIC_SetPriority(DMA_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00262 
00263 
00264     /* Configure GPDMA channel 0 -------------------------------------------------------------*/
00265     /* DMA Channel 0 */
00266     GPDMACfg.ChannelNum = 0;
00267         // Source memory
00268         GPDMACfg.SrcMemAddr = (uint32_t) &dma_src;
00269         // Destination memory - Not used
00270         GPDMACfg.DstMemAddr = 0;
00271         // Transfer size
00272         GPDMACfg.TransferSize = sizeof(dma_src);
00273         // Transfer width - not used
00274         GPDMACfg.TransferWidth = 0;
00275         // Transfer type
00276         GPDMACfg.TransferType = GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_M2P;
00277         // Source connection - unused
00278         GPDMACfg.SrcConn = 0;
00279         // Destination connection
00280         GPDMACfg.DstConn = GPDMA_CONN_SSP0_Tx;
00281         // Linker List Item - unused
00282         GPDMACfg.DMALLI = 0;
00283         // Setup channel with given parameter
00284         GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00285 
00286         /* Reset terminal counter */
00287         Channel0_TC = 0;
00288         /* Reset Error counter */
00289         Channel0_Err = 0;
00290 
00291 
00292     /* Configure GPDMA channel 1 -------------------------------------------------------------*/
00293     /* DMA Channel 1 */
00294         GPDMACfg.ChannelNum = 1;
00295         // Source memory - not used
00296         GPDMACfg.SrcMemAddr = 0;
00297         // Destination memory - Not used
00298         GPDMACfg.DstMemAddr = (uint32_t) &dma_dst;
00299         // Transfer size
00300         GPDMACfg.TransferSize = sizeof(dma_dst);
00301         // Transfer width - not used
00302         GPDMACfg.TransferWidth = 0;
00303         // Transfer type
00304         GPDMACfg.TransferType = GPDMA_TRANSFERTYPE_P2M;
00305         // Source connection
00306         GPDMACfg.SrcConn = GPDMA_CONN_SSP0_Rx;
00307         // Destination connection - not used
00308         GPDMACfg.DstConn = 0;
00309         // Linker List Item - unused
00310         GPDMACfg.DMALLI = 0;
00311         // Setup channel with given parameter
00312         GPDMA_Setup(&GPDMACfg);
00313 
00314         /* Reset terminal counter */
00315         Channel1_TC = 0;
00316         /* Reset Error counter */
00317         Channel1_Err = 0;
00318 
00319         _DBG_("Start transfer...");
00320 
00321     // Enable Tx and Rx DMA on SSP0
00322         SSP_DMACmd (LPC_SSP0, SSP_DMA_RX, ENABLE);
00323         SSP_DMACmd (LPC_SSP0, SSP_DMA_TX, ENABLE);
00324 
00325         // Enable GPDMA channel 0
00326         GPDMA_ChannelCmd(0, ENABLE);
00327         // Enable GPDMA channel 0
00328         GPDMA_ChannelCmd(1, ENABLE);
00329 
00330     // Enable interrupt for DMA
00331     NVIC_EnableIRQ (DMA_IRQn);
00332 
00333         /* Wait for GPDMA processing complete */
00334         while (((Channel0_TC == 0) && (Channel0_Err == 0)) \
00335                         || ((Channel1_TC == 0) && (Channel1_Err ==0)));
00336 
00337         /* Verify buffer */
00338         Buffer_Verify();
00339 
00340         _DBG_("Verify complete!");
00341 
00342     /* Loop forever */
00343     while(1);
00344     return 1;
00345 }
00346 
00347 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00348    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00349    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00350    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00351    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00352 int main(void)
00353 {
00354     return c_entry();
00355 }

00358 #ifdef  DEBUG
00359 /*******************************************************************************
00360 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00361 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00362 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00363 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00364 * @return               None
00365 *******************************************************************************/
00366 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00367 {
00368         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00369          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00370 
00371         /* Infinite loop */
00372         while(1);
00373 }
00374 #endif
